body:
we need more information - please use the issue template as described here:
https://github.com/owncloud/core/blob/master/contributing.md

### expected behaviour because of this errors in the web install warning: set_time_limit() [function.set-time-limit]: cannot set time limit in safe mode in /home/trebligc/public_html/setup-owncloud.php on line 32 warning: rename(tmp-owncloud1361639989/owncloud,./owncloud) [function.rename]: no such file or directory in /home/trebligc/public_html/setup-owncloud.php on line 103 the owncloud was just instaled via softaculous ### actual behaviour now the system is installed but the user interface is displayed worng ### steps to reproduce 1. fill softaculous form with credentials and path to the instalation folder 2. run the process 3. login into the system ### server configuration operating system: centos 5.9 i686 virtuozzo kernel version: 2.6.18-274.7.1.el5.028stab095.1 web server: apache version 2.2.23 database: mysql version 5.0.96-community php version: php 5.3.19 (cli) (built: dec 6 2012 23:42:43) owncloud version: 4.5.7 ### client configuration browser: firefox and chrome last version operating system: win 7 ultimate 64bit ### logs #### web server error log ``` [23-feb-2013 17:38:59 utc] php warning: mkdir() [function.mkdir]: safe mode restriction in effect. the script whose uid is 2780 is not allowed to access /tmp owned by uid 0 in /home/trebligc/public_html/owncloud/lib/cache/fileglobal.php on and now again the third time: disable php's safe mode....

ohh i think it was disable from the server because is a web hosting, and i request to the support to do it.

let me point them here.
